meanings.definition: Outtowers: to surpass in height or stature
meanings.sent1: The giraffe outtowers all the other animals in the zoo.
meanings.sent2: The skyscraper outtowers the surrounding buildings.
meanings.sent3: The sunflower outtowers the other flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent4: His ambition outtowers his peers' goals.
meanings.sent5: The mountain outtowers everything in sight.

meanings.definition: Outtowers: a structure or building that is taller than others in its vicinity
meanings.sent1: The outtowers of the city skyline are truly impressive.
meanings.sent2: The Eiffel Tower is a famous outtowers in Paris.
meanings.sent3: The outtowers of the castle made it easy to spot from afar.
meanings.sent4: The outtowers of the lighthouse guided ships safely to shore.
meanings.sent5: The outtowers of the skyscraper dominated the cityscape.

meanings.definition: Outtowers: to exceed or excel in comparison to others
meanings.sent1: Her kindness outtowers her sister's generosity.
meanings.sent2: The student's performance outtowers that of his classmates.
meanings.sent3: His appetite for ice cream outtowers his love for cake.
meanings.sent4: The champion outtowers all other competitors in skill.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's speed outtowers the rest of the team.
